20030000.text: (She has a worried look on his face.)

20030002.text:
Have you seen our <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</>?
Our dog hasn't come back from his walk.

20030004.text:
He's a fully grown dog, not a puppy.
He knows how to get back home and understands what we say.

20030005.text:
He's smart enough to recognize people.
And he'll give you his paw if you ask him to shake! And he's good at sitting and standing up.

20030006.text: <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</> must be a very smart dog.

20030007.text:
But he hasn't come back yet, and it's not because he's lost.
He's smart enough to find the way back home, even from the furthest reaches of the world.

20030008.text: Please find <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</>. He must be starving since yesterday...

20030009.text:
You'll be able to hear the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>bell</> he's wearing when you're close to him.
You can be sure it's him by checking the name on his <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>bell</>.

20030010.text: I'll let you know if I find him.

20030011.text: Do you happen to know <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</> the dog?

20030012.text:
Of course, I know <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</>. He's a very nice and gentle dog.
He's very big, too.

20030014.text: Why? Is something wrong? Wait, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</>'s gone missing?

20030015.text:
Well, it is unfortunate...
But it's just a missing dog. It's not the end of the world.

20030016.text: If he went out that way, he's more than likely dead.

20030017.text: I am searching just in case.

20030018.text: Then, you should go and ask the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Patrol</> at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>waterfall</>.

20030019.text: I saw <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</> walking alone toward the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>falls</>.

20030022.text:
Is that so? I haven't been able to keep an eye out...
I don't think I'll be able to tell you much about <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hope</>.

20030023.text:
Dogs are more sensitive than people to the sounds that a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Mandarava</> makes.
They can hear what we can't.

20030024.text: If there's a <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>dog</> here, it might've crossed paths with a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Mandarava</>.

20030027.text:
I might not know much about <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>that dog</>...
But wouldn't his <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>master</> be able to recognize him?

20030029.text: Then, I'll return this <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>bell</> to the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>owner</>.

20030030.text: That <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>dog</> must've been attacked by a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Mandarava</>.

20030031.text:
I should explain what happened delicately.
This won't be easy.

20030032.text: I'll leave it up to you.

20030033.text: (It kooks like he's lost his mind.)

20030034.text:
Huh? Did you say something to me?
I'm sorry, but could you repeat what you said?

20030035.text:
I haven't said anything.
Are you all right?

20030036.text:
Oh... I was careless to let out my feelings like that.
I'm worried about my <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>colleagues</> out at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>East Ecological Research Site</>.

20030037.text: We were <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>friends</> from a young age, and we came to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol</> together...

20030038.text: Is there a problem in that area?

20030039.text: Rumor has it that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</> is active again.

20030041.text:
I haven't seen it for myself, but I've heard that it's a terrifying monster.
If it's all right with you, would you help my <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>colleagues</>?

20030042.text: Ah, how may I help you?

20030043.text: This is what I came for... (...)

20030044.text:
Ah, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hantae</> really shouldn't have...
Recently, the number of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>animals in the jungle</> has grown out of hand.

20030045.text:
We've restricted people from entering,
and we ourselves can't go out on patrol, either.

20030046.text:
We don't know what will happen if we get surrounded.
At worst, we might run into <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</>...

20030048.text: To be honest, I haven't seen it for myself, but it's a formidable monster.

20030049.text:
We've already suffered casualties among the men.
We don't even know the exact whereabouts of the monster.

20030050.text: I'll patrol the area and relay the situation.

20030051.text:
I don't doubt your skills, but please be careful of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</>.
We'll give you an approximate location.

20030052.text: (Is this the location they told me about?)

20030053.text:
(<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</>?
Well, it doesn't seem to be here.)

20030054.text:
(It must have either moved
or the rumors were wrong.)

20030057.text:
I knew there were too many animals.
I should report this.

20030058.text: It may be best for us to cease patrols for the time being.

20030060.text:
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</> wasn't there.
Given the current situation, we have no idea where it is.

20030061.text:
Things would go much easier
if they were all in one place...

20030064.text: I beg you, don't even bring that up.

20030065.text: I'm completely ruined. There's no hope left.

20030066.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</> ate all the grain...
And there's nothing I can do.

20030068.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</> have always been around,
but they suddenly grew in number...

20030069.text:
It's gotten out of hand.
I'm just going to give up. I'll deal with the hunger by filling my stomach with water, I guess.

20030070.text: (It would be good to ask the experts about what to do...)

20030072.text: We're also looking into the sudden increase in <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</>, too.

20030073.text: We still haven't figured out a solution, though...

20030074.text: If we had to make a decision right now, then it would be to eliminate the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</>.

20030075.text:
We can use their meat as food,
and use the rest of their bodies as fertilizer.

20030078.text: We're also responding to the widening spread of the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</>...

20030079.text: But we're having trouble. This problem is much worse than we expected.

20030080.text: Our plan is to eliminate the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</> and reclaim our farmland.

20030081.text:
It seems the appearance of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</>
and sudden increase of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</> are related...

20030082.text: I don't have any concrete evidence yet, though.

20030083.text:
However, I will eliminate the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Greenhorns</>
and reclaim the farmland.

20030085.text:
(I suddenly feel
a strange sense of danger.)

20030086.text:
(The atmosphere inside
seems to be heavy.)

20030088.text:
(I shouldn't enter now
since I don't have any business here.)

20030089.text: This is the opinion of the experts... (...)

20030090.text:
I appreciate what you said...
But there's really nothing I can do.

20030092.text:
Still, since you know the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Saho</> and the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</>,
I'm sure something can be done.

20030093.text:
There was a
<textColor=[110:216:175:255]>place with a strange atmosphere</> inside the forest.

20030094.text:
I heard <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</> hasn't been spotted these past few days...
Perhaps <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</>'s over there?

20030096.text:
I heard that people in the past have tried to harm <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Baphomet</>...
Could it be that it wants revenge?

20030097.text:
Anyway, I really do hope the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</> and the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Saho</>
eliminate it. That monster is just horrifying...

20030098.text:
Well, that's that... First, I should focus on my job.
I'll be managing the tools here.

20030281.text:
Even if I wanted to take care of the tools...
I can't buy anything since I'm broke.

20030282.text: Is there anything you can do?

20030283.text:
Well, I'm good with my hands...
I could try to make something if I had the materials.

20030284.text: How are you going to get the materials?

20030285.text: I'm going to go to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>beach</> and collect some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>debris</>.

20030287.text: Well, I either starve to death or I get beaten and killed.

20030288.text: (Requesting an attack on the explorer base. <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Signed, Im</>)

20030289.text:
(It seems to be a request from a person whose <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>last name is Im</>.
The first name has been erased.)

20030290.text: (Im? Forget the requester, and read the rest.)

20030291.text:
(We arrived for the attack, but didn't receive our next orders.
We subsequently decided to give up the attack and retreat.)

20030292.text:
(Since we can't return because of the current and the winds,
we'll hide for three days and then go back.)

20030293.text: (Perhaps they had no intention to attack the base?)

20030294.text: Did you bring all this? It must've been heavy.

20030295.text: There were a lot of <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>materials</> near the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>shipwreck</>.

20030296.text: I think I can make some farming tools with these.

20030297.text: Wasn't it dangerous to get these?

20030298.text: There were <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blue Bandits</>, but it was no big deal.

20030299.text: It's a relief that nothing happened...

20030301.text:
Well, I can't start farming right away...
But I'm going to make it so that I can start farming once I'm ready.

20030302.text: Looks like I've finally found some hope! Thank you.

20030101.text: I'm currently developing an antidote for those dying from <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Snakecap</> poisoning.

20030102.text:
But since this is an antidote created from <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Snakecap</> poison...
I need to get my hands on some of that poison.

20030103.text:
I could collect it myself if I only needed a small quantity.
But there are so many people falling victim to the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Snakecaps</>...

20030104.text:
The antidote loses its effectiveness over time, too.
There's a limit to what I can do on my own.

20030106.text:
It is pretty satisfying work.
Helping people like this gives me a lot of pride...

20030107.text: Could you make more antidote if you had more <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Snakecaps</>?

20030108.text:
Well, I have the skills, so all I need is that poison.
I can make the antidote if you bring me <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Snakecaps</>.

20030109.text:
You're back. This will be enough to make a small batch of antidote.
First, I need to extract the poison...

20030110.text:
The leftover mushroom can be used for stew,
or it can be fermented to make mushroom beer. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water.

20030111.text: It's an absolute delicacy! You can't just buy it in stores.

20030112.text:
Mushroom beer can drive a person nuts!
A lot of people ask if it's poisonous...

20030113.text:
But actually, there isn't a single drop of poison. However...!
If you tell them there's just a little bit, they enjoy it more.

20030114.text:
Why do they prefer it if has some poison in it?
Well, there's a lot of strange people in this world with strange tastes. Don't you agree?

20030115.text: Be honest... Isn't making mushroom stew or mushroom beer your real objective?

20030116.text:
It may seem like that, but I have to make money on the side somehow.
Otherwise, I'd have to charge money for the antidote...

20030117.text:
Do you want the poor to just die?
This is all possible because people buy the mushroom beer at a high price.

20030118.text:
We should be grateful I can make stew and mushroom beer.
Would you care for a pot of stew later?

20030119.text: There are ghosts showing up? Maybe he's seeing things?

20030121.text:
I don't usually believe in this sort of thing,
but there's a guy who has been dispatched to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Pioneers' Graveyard</>.

20030122.text:
He's saying he's seen ghosts...
And that he can no longer work there.

20030124.text:
I don't know.
I suppose I wouldn't even be able to tell.

20030125.text:
If it's all right with you,
I'd be grateful if you could check it out.

20030127.text:
Yikes! You surprised me!
I thought you were something else!

20030129.text: I've come to check if there are ghosts.

20030130.text:
Ah. I had a strange feeling during my patrol a while ago.
Well, I am a little more sensitive to this sort of stuff than others...

20030131.text: Come to think of it, it didn't seem like a hostile presence.

20030132.text: But isn't it a little creepy?

20030133.text: Maybe it might've become hostile toward me over time?

20030134.text:
I'm just going to quit working at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>cemetery</>.
If they won't let me work somewhere else, I'm going to leave the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</>.

20030136.text: I don't belong here. I was just passing by...

20030137.text:
I saw another <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seeker</> member last time
and tried to ask him to clean the tombstone.

20030138.text:
But he just kept going on his way,
as if he hadn't heard me.

20030139.text: He seemed to think that a ghost talked to him.

20030140.text:
Oh, really? I guess that'd make sense in a <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>cemetery</>.
I should be more careful from now on...

20030141.text:
There were <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Fiery Souls</> over there with evil energy...
Maybe they're what's causing these misunderstandings.

20030143.text:
If it's all right with you, may I request for you to eliminate the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Fiery Souls</>?
I'm not in my best condition, so I can't get the job done.

20030144.text:
You should get some rest somewhere with some relaxing scenery.
You look very tired.

20030145.text: So, find anything out of the ordinary?

20030146.text: I wasn't able to find any special ghosts.

20030147.text:
Is that so? That's a relief.
I guess I got the wrong idea somehow.

20030148.text:
I eliminated the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Fiery Souls</>,
and cleaned the tombstone while I was at it.

20030149.text:
Thank you. I should've have been the one to handle that job...
I wasn't able to do anything last time since I was too busy running away.

20030150.text:
I'll learn from my mistakes this time
and work hard as the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>cemetery</> keeper again!

20030153.text: Why are you keeping your distance like that?

20030155.text:
If you're not busy,
would you like to go see the flowers with me?

20030156.text: (Be silent as you don't have a good answer.)

20030157.text:
Did I say something strange?
I need some flowers, along with some help.

20030159.text:
I don't know for sure.
A lot of explorers died trying to explore this place in the past...

20030160.text: They weren't able to bury and pay proper respects to the dead.

20030161.text:
I heard that's why they buried everybody together here,
where the condition of the land was comparably better.

20030163.text:
My father is also buried around here.
I just don't know where exactly. So...

20030164.text:
Whenever I come here, I leave a flower at a different tombstone.
One of these days, I'll actually give a flower to my father.

20030166.text:
Well, even if it's not my father,
I'm still showing respect for the departed.

20030167.text:
It's a little depressing coming here alone.
I think I'll be fine today, though.

20030168.text: It's all thanks to you. I really appreciate your help today.

20030169.text: If we only knew where the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scarlet Masks</>' base was located...

20030170.text: We can only move the troops after we get concrete evidence...

20030171.text: Is something going on at the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scarlet Masks</>' base.?

20030172.text: Ah! Greetings. It's not that important.

20030173.text:
For the entire supply of <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol</>,
the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Opulent Forest Base</>, and <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Foggy Forest Settlement</>...

20030174.text:
A lot of supplies go in and out of here.
That's why the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scarlet Masks</> have set up camp in the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>woods</> in this area.

20030175.text: The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</> will have a lot to worry about.

20030176.text:
They'll be easily defeated if our Elites are deployed
, since they're only just thieves.

20030177.text:
The main problem is that the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scarlet Masks</> are always running away and escaping,
and it's hard to get enough of our men to chase after them.

20030178.text:
If we could locate the exact location of the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>base</>,
it'll be only a matter of time before we drive them all out.

20030179.text: Here is the location of the base, along with <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>evidence</>.

20030180.text: Is this true? Did you find this there?

20030181.text: This will be concrete evidence to persuade the upper authorities.

20030182.text: <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scarlet Masks</>! We'll crush you for good this time.

20030183.text: You'll pay for stealing my custom-ordered peach tofu.

20030185.text:
Never mind.
I just said the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scarlet Masks</> were pests eating away at <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol</>.

20030186.text: We, the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</>, will drive them out!

20030189.text:
How could you be so late
when you're supposed to work, mrrow?

20030190.text:
Unacceptable, meow.
I'm <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Kuku</>, and I won't tolerate this, hiss.

20030191.text: Then again, beggars can't be choosers, mrrow.

20030192.text: We should get going now, meow!

20030194.text: Then, we'll figure it out later at the site, meow!

20030195.text:
We must quickly research
the effect that the foggy shade has on people, meow.

20030197.text:
Why are you so late?
Don't you know I hate that, hiss?

20030198.text: I am <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Kuku</>! This is unacceptable, hiss!

20030199.text: Okay, calm down for a sec.

20030200.text: Now's not the time to be choosing between milk and fish, mrrow.

20030201.text: Go and collect <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>dirt</> from over there!

20030203.text:
I won't accept excuses, but I am forgiving, meow.
Let's forget about your mistake fur now and focus on our work!

20030204.text:
Just so that you don't misunderstand...
I will pay you in full, even though you were late. So don't worry, mrrow!

20030207.text:
Don't get all startled.
It's just a small misunderstanding.

20030209.text: Are you talking about the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Plum Blossom's Leader</>?

20030210.text:
It's not right for the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Leader</> to be here, mrrow!
It's the disgusting <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion Mantis</>! Get rid of it, hiss!

20030211.text:
You seem pretty useful, meow.
How about becoming my personal porter and bodyguard, meow?

20030212.text: I have other things to do.

20030213.text: Other things? Well, maybe I can negotiate with your company, meow.

20030214.text:
I don't belong to a company.
You must have mistaken me for someone else.

20030215.text: Mrrrrow, really? Why didn't you tell me earlier?

20030216.text:
Why keep me in the dark?
You've made me look like a foolish <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Baron</>!

20030218.text: All right. I'll be fine, mrrow. I am a generous Baron after all.

20030219.text:
How about working with me,
even if you're not from a company, meow?

20030220.text:
You seem purretty useful.
Anyway, listen up.

20030222.text: There isn't a lot of water now, but there used to be lots of water in the past, meow.

20030223.text:
According to the records left by <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Varahtti</>,
who was one of the first explorers...

20030224.text:
A huge <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion Giant Mantis</> that creates an illusion fog recently appeared,
and that's when the water started to dry up, mrrow.

20030225.text: Are you listening to me, hiss?

20030227.text:
Right, so since you could get into danger,
I will tell you where the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion Giant Mantis</> is purrported to appear, meow.

20030229.text:
There's no need to decline my help, mrrow.
It's all because I'm worried about you. Let's go.

20030230.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Varahtti</>, who I mentioned earlier,
lost his life to the illusion fog, meow.

20030231.text:
There were many who fell victim to the illusion fog...
It's said they died from illusions and poisoning, hiss.

20030232.text: Poison doesn't turn a blind eye when it comes to one's position or organization, meow.

20030233.text:
It's also written in the records that an <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> elder, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Bichun</>,
was also killed by the Giant <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Mantis</> while protecting others, meow.

20030234.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion Giant Mantis</> is known to appear over there...
It'll be hard fur you to fight it alone. Run away once you get the chance, meow.

20030236.text:
Well, if people never came here in the first place,
the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Giant Mantis</> might not have ever done what it did.

20030237.text:
Then, those people wouldn't have died,
and there'd still be lots of water here...

20030239.text: (Should I tell him to back away a little?)

20030240.text:
Hey! What are you doing? Back away!
It's dangerous if you fall from here.

20030242.text:
The <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>waterfall</> here has the best scenery... So, people
often die or get hurt bad since they don't watch their step.

20030243.text:
Come to think of it, this place
has never had any safety railing, huh?

20030245.text: I should make a safety railing before I leave.

20030246.text:
I just need some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>wood</> that's resistant to water and some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>oil</> to coat it...
That should be enough. Bring me that, and I can take care of the rest.

20030247.text: Oho. This is some fine <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>material</>. I can make some good safety railing out of this.

20030248.text: I should've done this before that accident happened...

20030249.text: Then, maybe I wouldn't be alone here today.

20030250.text: Did something bad happen in the past?

20030251.text:
Well, there's nothing anyone can do about the past.
It would just be better if there weren't any accidents here anymore.

20030253.text: Help me deal with what I've lost. Well, I should get going...

20030254.text:
Thank you for everything, my friends...
My will is in my drawer...

20030256.text:
I lost at rock paper scissors...
Because of that, now I have to monitor <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong</>.

20030258.text:
Well, not really.
Most of the time, anyway.

20030259.text: Is it dangerous in certain cases?

20030260.text: Hmm... That's why it's recommended to write a will and keep it somewhere safe.

20030261.text:
How close we can approach <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong</>, and whether we can move the men or wagons...
It's all depends on his mood.

20030262.text: That's why someone needs to monitor <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong</>.

20030263.text: How do I determine his mood?

20030264.text: It's all in the manual. It's all important information that we've known for a long time..

20030265.text:
It might not say which moods are linked to specific actions,
but the info in there is correct, most of the time.

20030266.text: When do I have to be careful?

20030267.text:
It's actually fine, most of the time. Maybe one or two days in a year...
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong</> gets very angry.

20030268.text:
Then, whoever is watching him is in grave danger.
You have to escape right away.

20030269.text:
All men, return to the base immediately and cease all activities.
Using the entrance to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Simyu Valley</> is also forbidden.

20030271.text:
His mood was all right yesterday. He's probably fine today...
Just go and follow our fellow member, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Mok Chibon</>.

20030272.text:
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong</> doesn't always stay in one place...
This spot, though, is great for monitoring him.

20030274.text:
He's hard to see at first.
But you'll get used to it. It'll get easier.

20030275.text: How is <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong</> feeling today?

20030276.text:
Today, he seems mildly angry.
We shouldn't get any closer to him.

20030277.text:
Wow, that's amazing.
I can't even see a thing from here.

20030278.text:
Heheh! It's nothing special. I've had a lot of practice.
How about we get a little closer?

20030279.text:
Is it okay to do that
when he's mildly angry?

20030303.text: I'm sorry. I got too cocky...

20030304.text:
I shouldn't have done that when he was only mildly angry...
I've kind of riled up the Simyu tribe.

20030306.text:
It should be fine for now...
But we should leave the area right away.

20030307.text:
We must never make
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong angry</>, no matter what!

20030308.text: Phew... I think I've knocked ten years off my life expectancy today.

20030309.text:
Wait... That's our jurisdiction, too?
Isn't that too much?

20030311.text:
Ah! You're here! What's wrong? Well...
This is an internal matter for the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</>, but...

20030312.text:
I was questioning why the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Abandoned Watchtower</> and its <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>surrounding coasts</> are not
under <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Dojung Port</>'s jurisdiction.

20030313.text: The <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>coast</> looks pretty close to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Dojung Port</>.

20030314.text: But the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Abandoned Watchtower</> is closer to our base.

20030315.text:
And based on the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>watchtower</>, the surrounding <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>coastline</>
is designated as our jurisdiction.

20030317.text:
It wouldn't be a bad idea to say that the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>coast</> over there belongs to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Dojung Port</>,
and this side is our <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>base</>...

20030318.text:
But we can't change that now.
I guess it's up to us to take care of it.

20030320.text:
Yes. The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>coastal creatures</> have been reproducing at an abnormal rate...
It's getting out of hand.

20030321.text:
I don't want to go and ask <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Dojung Port</> for help, either...
We're in quite a pickle here.

20030322.text: We don't even have a place where we can rest after our duties...

20030323.text: Drinking Blue Liquor while watching the sunset was my one joy in life...

20030324.text: Is there a place with a good view?

20030325.text:
There used to be.
No, wait, it's still there.

20030326.text: The <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>southern coast</> of the base has an amazing view during sunset.

20030328.text:
It's not like there weren't any <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Oduksinis</> before...
But things have gotten worse now.

20030329.text:
Back when there were just a few of them, I could take care of them,
or avoid them if I felt like it...

20030330.text:
But there are far too many of them now...
We might as well call that place <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Oduksini</> Coast.

20030331.text:
And it's not like I can drag along all the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</> out there
and clear the coast so I can enjoy Blue Liquor.

20030332.text:
It must be upsetting
to lose such a great place to relax.

20030333.text:
Exactly! <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ko Gondae</> needs to have a drink
from time to time to let off some steam, too...

20030334.text:
And when he's annoyed, he takes it out on me!
It's been getting pretty tough, and it's not like I can say anything about it...

20030335.text: Oh! If it's all right with you, can I ask you for directions?

20030337.text:
I'm on my way to a place called the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Magnificent Hillside</>.
Is it nearby?

20030338.text: You are still pretty far from it.

20030340.text: Me? I came from the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Foggy Forest Settlement</>.

20030341.text: It seems you're going in the wrong direction.

20030342.text:
No way, I have a great sense of direction.
I'm sure I'm going the right way.

20030345.text:
Given how chaotic the world is right now...
Could it be that the cardinal directions themselves have changed?

20030346.text:
Hm. I can bring you
to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Foggy Forest Settlement</>.

20030347.text: Ah! Now that I'm here, I think I can find my way.

20030348.text:
We're near the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Scarlet Masks Forest</>, right?
You'd better watch out for those<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scarlet Masks</>!

20030349.text: The <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Scarlet Masks Forest</> is still far away.

20030350.text:
What? People are often amazed by my sense of direction...
Are you sure?

20030351.text: (That sure is "amazing." But, I shouldn't say it out loud.)

20030353.text:
Can you make it to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Magnificent Hillside</>
by yourself?

20030354.text:
Normally, that wouldn't be a problem...
But given how things are nowadays...

20030355.text:
I think I will ask the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Soul Bridge</>
for a teleport.

20030357.text: And I wasted some time too, haha!

20030359.text: Of course you can come with me.

20030360.text: Just tell me when you're ready.

20030363.text: We are here, safe and sound.

20030365.text:
It would be a good idea to ask for the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Soul Bridge</>'s service
when traveling such a long distance next time.

20030366.text:
Right? Even though it's quite dizzying,
it is pretty convenient.

20030368.text: Ah, now I have no idea what to do. I can't see anything ahead of me.

20030370.text: Ah! No. I was just talking to myself.

20030371.text:
I was just thinking about all the work that needs to be done this week...
I was just stressing out over that.

20030372.text:
I suppose I can't just observe <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ape King Ogong</> all week.
It's all part of my duty as well.

20030374.text:
I suppose you can call it weeding.
I need to remove <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Bulbaries</> on a regular basis.

20030375.text: Then, again, if they were regular plants, my life wouldn't be in so much danger...

20030376.text: I think combative extermination is probably a better term.

20030379.text: You must be pretty confident in your skills since you made it all the way here...

20030380.text: But still, you should watch out for <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Dokumo</>.

20030382.text: It's a huge and extremely dangerous monster.

20030383.text: It normally doesn't leave its nest...

20030384.text: But if it does, that's usually trouble.

20030385.text:
I will inform you right away
if I ever see <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Dokumo</> nearby.

20030387.text:
That's a relief.
Its <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>nest</> is in there.

20030388.text: Even if you're curious, do not approach it.

20030390.text: Hey, you! Come over here for a second, mrrow!

20030392.text:
I'm making some medicine,
but I need a little more <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>moss</>, meow!

20030393.text: Um... Um... Actually, I need vewy much more moss, meow.

20030394.text: It's okay. Tell me what you need.

20030395.text:
It's a precious <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>moss</> that
only grows on living <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>tree spirits</>, meow!

20030396.text: I need a little... no, vewy much of it, meow!

20030397.text:
You want
the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>moss</> from the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>tree spirits</>?

20030398.text:
You can find it from the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>tree spirits</>
at <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Sunrise Climb</>, meow!

20030400.text: Wow! So much moss! Amazing, mrrow!

20030402.text:
Don't say that, mrrow... I had to scratch a <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>tree spirit</>'s back
for a whole hour,

20030403.text:
But I only got one-eighth
of this, meow!

20030404.text: How did you do this? I want to learn, too, meow!

20030405.text: Do you scratch a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>tree spirit</>'s back?

20030406.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Tree spirits</> love it
when you scratch their backs, mrrow!

20030409.text: I was on patrol when... <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Horyong</> of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Peach Blossom</> was suddenly there.

20030410.text: Although he's not my superior, I politely greeted him but...

20030413.text: But when I looked closely! He wasn't <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Horyong</>.

20030415.text: It was an <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion</>. I was deceived.

20030416.text: But... I would have left it alone if it was just once...

20030417.text: But I met <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Moonwind</> on the way.

20030419.text: Of course! I greeted her. But... it was an <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion</> again.

20030420.text: After that, I really don't want to go on patrol.

20030421.text: Can you get rid of those <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusions</> for me?

20030422.text: (Hmm... Are they still not aware of their own condition?)

20030423.text:
(If they're this scared of ghosts...
Maybe it's better not to tell them the truth.)

20030424.text: You should leave the Fiery Souls to me.

20030425.text: Oh, that's a small group. That's what I was thinking of, though.

20030427.text: This is a report that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blood Plague</> is attacking the passageways more often. I can't stand it any longer. So may I ask you a favor? do.

20030429.text: I plan to create and place a trap. <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Valley Windway</> in <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Rock Crow Horn If you prepare </>, we will prepare the rest of the ingredients.

20030430.text: Thank you. Small. Thanks to you, we were able to set up the trap safely.

20030432.text: I hope this will secure the passageway for a while. Now, I have prepared a small reward. Please accept it without hesitation. I wish you good luck.

20030434.text: Oh, dear. Well done anyway. I have a favor to ask of you.

20030436.text: Destroy some <textColor=[110:216:175:255]><textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion</> of <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Mistshade Forest</>. textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Welcome</>I can't work because I'm afraid.

20030437.text: (It seems to be understandable to some extent)

20030438.text: I was going to do it myself, but there is also a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Illusion in my form</> or something.

20030440.text: Thank you. My case works great.

20030441.text: Thanks to you, the passageway is somewhat safe. Haha. Thank you.

20030443.text: It's not a big deal. Here are the things I prepared for you.

20030445.text: I'll look for you next time I have another request!

20030448.text: We're here to dig up herbs. But there are too many <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scary friends</> around. Help our herbalists a little.

20030451.text: Looks like we met! Where did that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>unlucky silver hair</> go?

20030452.text: (They say they've been away for a while)

20030453.text: Heh. I'm glad there's a human who can speak.

20030455.text: Ah. How did you know!? It's like there's a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Gaestrogenus</> somewhere here. I want you to get it. I'm begging you like this.

20030459.text: Why do you like that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>grass</> so much?

20030466.text: I came here because the nature of the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Sea Moon Continent</> is superb and spectacular, but I don't know what this is!

20030468.text: I was worried about the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>The Fighters</>, but some <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>The Corrupt Sheep</> were poached. I've started.

20030471.text: Oh, you did a good job. I hope this puts my mind at ease a bit.

20030473.text: It won't be rooted out, but first, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Farm Captain</> <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Recovered poach</> I'll pass it on to you. See you next time.

20030475.text: Oh, see you here again! What's going on here?

20030477.text: That's right. I'm from our, ah, no, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Moonlight</> Lord Moon.

20030478.text: So, can you help me? <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Moonlight</>The schedule requested by <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Moonlight</> is too tight...

20030480.text: Oh thank you. So get me some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Paradise-use objects</>. They're also worth researching...

20030482.text: No, it's not what it is. This time, you have to do it yourself.

20030483.text: Ugh. I'd rather just ask <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, right?

20030485.text: It was originally supposed to be <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Steelfist</>. I can't. I'll have to ask someone for sure. <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Get</> <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Various materials</> from Black Mud

20030487.text: <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Crocodile skin, tortoise skin, tough cobweb</>? Simple enough, isn't it?

20030489.text: Then I'll be waiting for you.

20030490.text: Oh! Sohyeok. See you here again. What's going on here?

20030491.text: (Greetings greetings and giving you the latest news)

20030492.text: Well, that's right. It worked out. I need to prepare <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Sunrise</>, but I'm short on staff. I'm thinking of borrowing your hand. Haha . Every time I see this, I just ask for a favor.

20030494.text: Then I'll ask you without hesitation. Dynamics of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Myomyeon</> in <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Sunrise Slope</> Let me take a look.

20030495.text: Oh, you're here. I have one more request.

20030497.text: I need to get <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Sunrise</> for <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Popbal leaves</>, but there are around <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>There are too many verses</>. <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Get rid of some verses</> and we'll do the rest.

20030500.text: It's been a while since I've seen you. How have you been?

20030502.text: Well, you see. Our <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ereda</> is finding stability thanks to the small cooperation.

20030504.text: Hmm... I'm embarrassed to have met Sohyeop like this, and I'm afraid I'll be taken care of again. Are you okay?

20030505.text: (Anything of Oreum is said to be fine)

20030506.text: Haha, it makes me feel much more comfortable when you say that. Then I'll tell you more comfortably.

20030507.text: Nothing else, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>The Black Dawn</> is attacking the sect that worships the divine beast. Of course, our Ereda is also the target.

20030508.text: <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Waterfog Plateau</> has <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>some of their troops</>, so I'm here to defeat them. .If you can help me, it will be ten thousand, ten thousand miles.

20030513.text: I just wanted to say thank you. Thank you.

20030515.text: Let's talk about the heavy stuff here. Okay, let's talk about the mission. It's none other than the intelligence that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>The Black Dawn</> is doing something terrible. There is.

20030517.text: You seem to be planning on making a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>military</> using <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>verses</> .<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Give them a good night's sleep</> to prevent them from being used by <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blackdawn</> .

20030520.text: Where the hell are you shooting for a little kid?

20030521.text: …the diligence is just like that child.

20030522.text: (Hmm? <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Younggyowon</>? This is the first Barong I've ever seen?)

20030523.text: ...Huh?... You! Oh my gosh, it's you! \nCome closer!

20030524.text: Oh, it looks like this. \nFortunately, it doesn't look sloppy.

20030525.text: (Ask if you know yourself. And the way you speak…)

20030526.text: Wow, what are you talking about?! \nThis body is Barong, I came to inform you of the return of <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Yaru</>!

20030529.text: Oh! That's right. <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Yaru</> is the most hidden among the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Gods</>.

20030531.text: Oh, it's a misunderstanding! Anyway, starting with the discovery of <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Yaru's Hourglass</>, there were signs that they were going to resume their activities soon.

20030532.text: And finally! <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Yaru's Box</> has regained its power, and even <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Spirit Stone</> has been found!

20030533.text: <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Spellstone</> is a stone that contains the power of text, but it cannot express its power by itself.\nBut <textColor=[255:

20030534.text: It looks like you didn't understand it just by looking at it, but it's okay. \nNow, let's get the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Spirit Stone</> here! Let's try it ourselves!

20030536.text: (Answers feeling, admiring that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Younggyowon</> knows so much)

20030537.text: What is this~ Of course, other Barongs may not know... \nAh, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Spirit Stone</> can be obtained by melting rare equipment.

20030539.text: The fact that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Yaru</> started their activities... that they regained the power that humans had forgotten...\nMaybe soon a great ordeal that cannot be overcome with the current power will come

20030540.text: Then there won't be time to relax like this?

20030542.text: He's a cute guy. \n How strong can he really be... I'm looking forward to it.
